result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Ayers Jr.

records.addlTxt: The 10/5/2022 Hearing has been rescheduled to 12/9/2022 at 9:00 am by the Court due to a week long jury trial going on.

09:06 AM
Attorney Michael Robert Barth appeared for the Defendant, Andrew Ayers.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, def. in-custody in Illinois, needs more time.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant, Andrew Ayers, appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

123PM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Mike Barth.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on May 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Bond continued.  sg
Status conference on May 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Andrew Ayers, appeared.  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons especially Firearms.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Michael B. and Terrance C.

02:02 to 02:07 PM  
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.  Clerk PT.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 3/22/22 @ 915am.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).    jk
